results.title: Sabrina = Sabrina fair
results.brief_description: Linus and David Larrabee are the two sons of a very wealthy Long Island family. Linus is all work, while David is all playboy. Meanwhile, Sabrina Fairchild is the young, shy, awkward daughter of the family’s chaffeur, who has been infatuated with David all her life. After a two year absence in Paris, Sabrina returns an elegant, sophisticated and beautiful woman. Suddenly, she finds that she has finally captured David’s attention, but as she does so, she finds herself falling in love with Linus, and he with her. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Audrey Hepburn, William Holden and Walter Hampden.

results.title: Everyone says I love you
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe, Jack Rollins, Robert Greenhut, Buena Vista Pictures, Magnolia Productions, Miramax Films and Sweetland Films BV
results.brief_description: This story of a very well off family living in New York takes the audience on a journey through their daily lives, highlighting the high and lows. The basic family set-up involves the two parents, Bob (Alan Alda) and Steffi (Goldie Hawn), four daughters, a son, a grandfather, and Joe (Woody Allen) - Steffi’s ex-husband. Joe is still very much a part of the family and regularly visits from his home in Paris. Joe seems to have had an endless array of failed relationships, and continuously pines for his ex-lovers. Meanwhile, the eldest daughter, Skylar (Drew Barrymore) is deeply in love with Holden (Edward Norton). Music and an ensemble performance drive the intertwined love stories, which revolve around the members of an extended blended family. The story structure is almost a dance of life that continuously circles around in a cycle of love found, lost, and then found again. The disparate story elements are unified by the use of the narrator DJ (Natasha Lyonne), who is the college-age daughter of Steffi by a previous marriage to Joe. Like almost everyone else in the film, DJ is a romantic at heart who seems to be always falling in and out of love. In addition to narrating, she acts as cupid in helping Joe meet Von (Julia Roberts), a woman he has fallen in love with at first sight. All the principal actors are given at least one song, and with the exception of Drew Barrymore, do their own singing rather than have the voice of a professional singer dubbed in.

results.title: Clerks
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Scott Mosier and View Askew Productions
results.brief_description: The first in a planned ‘Jersey Trilogy’ (which now includes ‘Mall Rats’ and ‘Chasing Amy’), Kevin Smith’s low budget feature debut captures with loads of humour and pop culture references, the malaises of 20 somethings struggling with relationships and working in dead end jobs they are way over qualified to be in. Twenty two year old Dante Hicks (Brian O’Halloran) works at the local Quick stop convenience store in New Jersey, a job he resents and finds almost unbearable if it wasn’t for his best friend Randal (Jeff Anderson), working at the video shop next door. ‘Clerks’ covers one eventful day of their lives as they ponder the unfair work practices of the evil empire in the Star Wars trilogy, find out what ‘snowballing’ is, insult customers, and grapple with their own uncertain future. All the while turning the work ethos on its head. Meanwhile, outside the store local drug dealers Silent Bob (Kevin Smith) and his sidekick Jay (Jason Mewes) give their own skewed philosophy on life. Cast also includes Marilyn Ghigliotti, Lisa Spoonhauer and Scott Mosier. (Awards: 1994 Sundance Film Festival Filmmakers Trophy and 1994 Cannes Young Cinema Award)

results.title: Fools rush in
results.creator_credit: Andy Tennant, Doug Draizin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alex Whitman is a high-flying New York yuppie sent by his company to open a nightclub in Las Vegas. It is a reluctant move for him, though once there, he meets the beautiful Mexican photographer, Isabel Fuentes. Though opposites in nearly every way, romantic sparks fly and the two have a passionate one night stand. Three months later, Isabel shows up pregnant with his child and every intention of keeping it. The two hastily marry in a Vegas chapel while an Elvis impersonator acts as the witness. A head-on collision of cultures ensues, prompting the contemplation of a break-up. A large family gathering, planned by Isabel, grows larger due to surprise family guests, thus creating a comedy of errors before the story draws to its predictable romantic close. Cast includes Matthew Perry, Salma Hayek, Jon Tenney, Carlos Gomez and Tomas Milian.

results.title: Female perversions
results.creator_credit: Susan Streitfeld, Mindy Affrime and Mindy Affrime Productions
results.brief_description: This fascinating, fragmented and complex drama eschews traditional narrative structure to present an intellectually challenging, feminist adaptation of Louise Kaplan’s book “Female Perversions: the Temptations of Emma Bovary.” The film centres on Eve, a talented lawyer who has just won a case against a disreputable business magnate. However, anticipating a meeting with the governor regarding her aspirations to become a judge brings to the surface insecurities and anxieties. She compensates for her lack of self-esteem by relying more and more on her captivating looks, and by buying expensive lingerie and make-up. Just as Eve is facing the highest point in her life, Madelyn, her unstable sister, is experiencing her lowest when she is arrested for shoplifting. When an incident from their childhood resurfaces, both sisters must confront their painful issues and find some sense of control in their lives. Cast includes: Tilda Swinton, Amy Madigan, Karen Sillas, Laila Robins and Clancy Brown.

results.title: Flashdance
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer, Paramount Pictures and PolyGram
results.brief_description: Flashdance is the story of Alex Owens, a fiercely determined 18 year old who is a Pittsburgh steel-mill welder by day, and a bar dancer by night. We follow her struggle to gain independence, find love, and to realise her dream for a career in modern dance. Includes music by Giorgio Moroder. Cast includes Jennifer Beals, Michael Nouri, Lilia Skala, Sunny Johnson and Kyle Heffner.

results.title: The Wings of the dove
results.creator_credit: Iain Softley, David Parfitt, Stephen Evans, Miramax Films and Renaissance Dove
results.brief_description: When Kate (Helena Bonham-Carter) falls in love with middle class journalist Martin (Linus Roache), her benefactor Aunt refuses to accept their union, believing her niece can do better. She offers Kate an ultimatum, stay with her lover and renounce any financial support for herself and her father, or assume her rightful place in society and promise to never see him again. Months later, an American heiress, Millie (Alison Elliot), enters their milieu and Kate forms a friendship with the new visitor. When Kate discovers that Millie is not only rich, but dying, her mind toys with the possibility of finding a way that she and Martin can be together and financially successful- Martin must fall in love with Millie. Set in Venice in the early 1900’s, this lavish period drama is based on the novel by Henry James. Cast includes Elizabeth McGovern, Charlotte Rampling and Michael Gambon.

results.title: Two mules for Sister Sara
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Carroll Case, Martin Rackin and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Two Mules for Sister Sara is a freewheeling, anarchic adventure set in a French-occupied Mexico in the 19th century. An American mercenary (Clint Eastwood) rescues a nun (Shirley Maclaine) from her would-be-molesters, only to later discover that the chance meeting has been a stroke of luck for him, as she knows a great deal about the officers in the garrison he plans to invade. As they embark on a journey together, there develops a sexual tension between the two which comes to an explosive end together with the garrison under attack. Includes a musical score by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: Ridicule
results.creator_credit: Patrice Leconte, Michele Arnould, Canal+, PolyGram and Sofica Investimage 4
results.brief_description: Set in the flamboyant court of Louis XVI, this is a sharp, satirical depiction of the excesses of court life. A life where men can be driven to suicide by the one thing that must be avoided at all costs: being the object of ridicule. Gregoire Ponceludon de Malavoy (Charles Berling), descendant of an old provincial family which has recently fallen on harsh times, approaches the court to appeal for funding for a draining project to save his province. Gregoire is unschooled in the practice of coiffing, face powder, false modesty and acerbic remarks, however he quickly wizens up to court protocol when he is befriended by the Marquis de Bellegarde (Jean Rochefort), an old doctor familiar in the ways of the court. The Marquis believes that Gregoire has the required amount of wit to infiltrate the royal court and make a successful appeal, now all Gregoire has to do is steer clear of humiliation and love as he prepares for an audience with the king. Cast includes Fanny Ardant, Charles Berling, Bernard Giraudeau, Judith Godreche and Jean Rochefort. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Paths of glory
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, James B. Harris, Bryna Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s World War One drama is a compelling anti-war film about the absurdities and horrors of war. Based on Humphrey Cobb’s novel, and co-written by Kubrick and Jim Thompson, ‘Paths of glory’ looks at the political machinations and power plays that ultimately decide who lives and dies in times of war, the cost and meaning of a life reduced to mere numbers and strategic manoeuvre. Set amongst the trenches and later on the decadent Chateau’s occupied by the French army’s elite, the films central courtroom drama focuses on the efforts of Colonel Dax (Kirk Douglas) to free three French soldiers (Joseph Turkel, Timothy Carey and Ralph Meeker) accused of cowardice for wisely retreating from a suicide mission to storm an Ant Hill occupied by the German army. Kubrick views the efforts of the French military to condemn these innocent men to death with detached bitter irony, leaving the films powerful message for it’s moving closing moments. Cast includes George Macready, Adolphe Menjou, Wayne Morris, Richard Anderson
